content.question: Nation Alpha can produce either 3 units of good <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or 1 unit of good <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> with one hour of labor, whereas nation Beta can produce either 4 units of good <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> or 2 units of good <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> with one hour of labor. Assuming that labor is the only input, which of the following is true?

choices.label: Beta has an absolute advantage in the production of good <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Alpha has an absolute advantage in the production of good <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Beta has a comparative advantage in the production of good <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Alpha has a comparative advantage in the production of good <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Alpha has both an absolute and comparative advantage in the production of good <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Beta has an absolute advantage in the production of good <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
